column1:
BE 01 : Do you have one control environment that covers all services provided by your company?

Control environment is defined as the set of controls that apply to the products and services that you provide. Simply put, will the responses to this question set apply to all of the services that you provide? Or are there differences in policies, standards, procedures and controls across your organizations products and services?
column4:
Integral Development Corporation has one control environment that covers all services provided by its company in place.

This is the only control environment at Integral Development Corporation. Integral Development Corporation provides a platform for liquidity management, pricing, distribution and risk management in the foreign exchange market for their customers. Integral Development Corporation facilitates the services via email, SFTP, and databases for their customers. Integral Development Corporation stores non-public information in electronic data forms. This control environment includes the use of internet facing applications. Applications include FX trading management systems. Applications are custom developed in-house. Data is hosted at co-located datacenter(s). Integral Development Corporation uses Equinix for co-location data center services.  The data centers are located at Secaucus, New Jersey, 07094, United States and Slough, Berkshire, SL1 4NB, United Kingdom and Tokyo, 135-0051, Japan. The headquarters is located at 3000 El Camino Real, 2 Palo Alto Square, 6th Floor, Palo Alto, California, 94306, United States. Service processing facilities(s) are located at 3000 El Camino Real, 2 Palo Alto Square, 6th Floor, Palo Alto, California, 94306, United States. This control environment covers all global locations. Based on the services provided by Integral Development Corporation, Cloud Computing, Customer Facing, and Inventory Control are out of scope.

column1:
BE 08: Does your company have an Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) Policy or Program requirement(s) for your organization and supply chain?

If yes, please attach.
Artifact Required: Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) Policy or Program documents (e.g., policy, procedures)

Design Elements:
1. Labor, health, and safety commitments
2. Policy(ies) prohibiting forced/child labor in your operations and your supply chain
3. Due diligence processes to assess and address risk of forced/child labor occurring in your operations and your supply chain (e.g. risk assessment, training, supply chain due diligence)
4. Public reporting/disclosure of current greenhouse gas emissions (Scope 1 and 2)
5. Public greenhouse gas emissions reduction target (% and date by which target will be achieved) 
6. Public reporting/disclosure of workforce representation by gender and by race/ethnicity background
7. Public reporting/disclosure of Board representation by gender and by race/ethnicity background
column5:
Integral Development Corporation does have an Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) Policy/Program in place. And is designed and tailored to Integral's operations and specific service offering.  Integral is a high tech business which requires employees to have significant education and experience, which is also required by any suppliers Integral may use.  The risk of the use of child labor is very low.  Moreover, Integral does not manufacture product and its operations do not produce any material greenhouse gas. 

The following design elements are in place:
1. Labor, health, and safety commitments
    New Policy Text US 0121.pdf [Stage 5] - Page 3, Section Employment Status 

6. Public reporting/disclosure of workforce representation by gender and by race/ethnicity background
    New Policy Text US 0121.pdf [Stage 5] - Page 2, Section Equal Opportunity Employment 

7. Public reporting/disclosure of Board representation by gender and by race/ethnicity background
    New Policy Text US 0121.pdf [Stage 5] - Page 2, Section Equal Opportunity Employment

Evidence referenced:
New Policy Text US 0121.pdf [Stage 5]
column9: As noted, Integral has a ESG policy that is designed and tailored to Integral's operations and specific service offering.  Integral is a high tech business which requires employees to have significant education and experience, which is also required by any suppliers Integral may use.  Thus, the risk of the use of child labor is very low.  Moreover, Integral does not manufacture product and its operations do not produce any material greenhouse gas.  Nevertheless, in order to address this Assessor Observation, Integral has updated its ESG as attached.
column12: Design Elements 4 and 5 were not captured in "BE002 - Corporate Social Responsibility policy_Excerpts HR Policy.pdf".

column1:
BE 10: Has your company or have any associated persons had any incidents, investigations or allegations of bribery, privacy complaints corruption, money laundering, misrepresentation, or court proceedings or litigation related to breaches of legislation, products, or services or any other similar activities within the last 5 years? 

If yes, what action(s) have been taken by the Regulator/the Courts and remedial actions taken by your Organization?

*Associated persons is defined as senior management and employees as well as subcontractors who may have access to critical systems or confidential information.
column5: Integral Development Corporation has not had incidents, investigations or allegations of bribery, corruption, money laundering, misrepresentation, or court proceedings or litigation related to breaches of legislation, products, or services or any other similar activities within the last 5 years.

column1:

column5: Integral Development Corporation has not had regulatory consent orders/decrees, going concerns, high-risk exam findings, or matters requiring attention pertaining to any of its services in the last 24 months.
